content.description: <math alttext="B a C O 3, solid, is in equilibrium with B a with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus C O 3 with a negative 2 charge, aqueous. K s p, equals 8.1 times 10 to the negative 9 power." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>B</mtext><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>B</mtext><msup><mtext>a</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub><mmultiscripts><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><none></none><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></mmultiscripts></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="2.0em"></mspace><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>8.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></math>
content.question: The dissolution of <math alttext="B a C O 3, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in water is represented above. A <math alttext="20.0 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the negative 4 power, molar, B a, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>B</mtext><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>(N</mtext><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub><mtext>)</mtext><mmultiscripts><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>2</mn><none></none></mmultiscripts></math> is mixed with an <math alttext="80.0 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the negative 4 power, molar, N a 2 C O 3, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mtext>a</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mn>3</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. Which of the following correctly predicts and explains the outcome?

choices.label: A precipitate will form, because <math alttext="Q equals, 1.0 times 10 to the negative 8 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></math>.

A precipitate will form, because <math alttext="Q equals, 1.6 times 10 to the negative 9 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></math>.

A precipitate will not form, because <math alttext="Q equals, 1.0 times 10 to the negative 8 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></math>.

A precipitate will not form, because <math alttext="Q equals, 1.6 times 10 to the negative 9 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></math>.

content.answer: A precipitate will not form, because <math alttext="Q equals, 1.6 times 10 to the negative 9 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></math>.

topic.text: 7.10: Reaction Quotient and Le Châtelier's Principle

skill.text: 2.B: Formulate a hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
